intro: Flueggea flueggeoides, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant has smooth, often silver-green leaves and produces showy yellow or orange flowers in clusters. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Its fleshy, spiny fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by animals and wind.
